Yes, you can still enjoy pizza and get leaner. The key is to modify your pizza to make it more nutritious and balanced. Here are some tips:

1. Opt for a whole-grain crust: Whole-grain crusts are a healthier and more filling option than white flour crusts. They'll also provide fiber and other important nutrients.

2. Add vegetables: Vegetable toppings like peppers, mushrooms, and onions can add fiber, vitamins, and minerals. Vegetables can also make your pizza more filling and satisfying.

3. Use lean protein: Choose lean protein toppings like chicken or shrimp rather than high-fat meats like pepperoni or sausage.

4. Control portion size: Limit how much pizza you eat and combine it with a salad or other healthy side dish.

5. Avoid high-calorie additions: Keep extra cheese, sauces, and dips to a minimum. These can quickly add calories and unhealthy fats.

By making these modifications, you can enjoy pizza while still achieving your fitness goals. Remember, moderation is key, and making healthy choices most of the time will help you enjoy indulgences like pizza guilt-free.
